ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I earned an incredible foundation of French literature and improved my writing skills in French greatly.
Knowledge of French literature, ability to write analytical essays on literature in French, understanding of the evolution of French culture and the theme of exile through various texts

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I personally did not see any weaknesses---the course covers a lot of books, but the readings were always manageable and it was a fantastic survey that allowed the students to get a taste of a wide range of French literature. Professor Pinzka provided a lot of opportunities for us to improve our grade as well through the rewriting of final essays especially.
The pacing of writing assignments was goodenough to keep me engaged but not too overwhelming. That goes for the oral assignments too (presentations and ripostes)
Some of the readings were very good but overall the class felt like a 9th grade English class taught in French.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I definitely would! Your French skills will improve dramatically and so will your love and appreciation for French literature.
Yes, it is a good immersion to francophone literature. I enjoyed the discussions.

extras.title: FREN 170 02 - Intro Study of French Lit
